alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; San Mateo; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 10:41AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Mateo and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fremont, Hayward, Antioch, San Leandro, Livermore, San Ramon, Pleasanton, Union City, Palo Alto, Pittsburg, Dublin, Newark, Danville, Oakley, Menlo Park, Castro Valley, San Lorenzo, Brentwood, Discovery Bay and Blackhawk-Camino Tassajara. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; San Mateo; Santa Clara
